agesno.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
agesno.comment: Age of Snow (when computing the time-mean here, the time samples, weighted by the mass of snow on the land portion of the grid cell, are accumulated and then divided by the sum of the weights.  Reported as missing data in regions free of snow on land.

albc.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
albc.comment: Albedo of the vegetation: fraction of incoming solar radiation which is reflected before reaching the ground.

albsn.cell_methods: area: time: mean where snow (comment: mask=snc)
albsn.comment: Albedo of the snow-covered surface, averaged over the grid cell.

aod550volso4.long_name: Aerosol Optical Depth at 550nm Due to Stratospheric Volcanic Aerosols
aod550volso4.comment: Aerosol optical depth at 550nm due to stratospheric volcanic aerosols

ares.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
ares.comment: The 'aerodynamic_resistance' is the resistance to mixing through the boundary layer toward the surface by means of the dominant process, turbulent transport. Reference: Wesely, M. L., 1989,  doi:10.1016/0004-6981(89)90153-4.

ccldncl.long_name: Cloud Droplet Number Concentration of Convective Cloud Tops
ccldncl.comment: Droplets are liquid only.  Report concentration 'as seen from space' over convective liquid cloudy portion of grid cell.  This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, it is better to sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Weight by total liquid cloud top fraction of  (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.

cldnci.long_name: Ice Crystal Number Concentration of Cloud Tops
cldnci.comment: Concentration 'as seen from space' over ice-cloud portion of grid cell.  This is the value from uppermost model layer with ice cloud or, if available, it is the sum over all ice cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Weight by total ice cloud top fraction (as seen from TOA) of each time sample when computing monthly mean.

cldnvi.comment: Droplets are liquid only.  Values are weighted by liquid cloud fraction in each layer when vertically integrating, and for monthly means the samples are weighted by total liquid cloud fraction (as seen from TOA).

clivic.comment: calculate mass of convective ice water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). This includes precipitating frozen hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

clt.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
clt.comment: Total cloud area fraction (reported as a percentage) for the whole atmospheric column, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.

clwvic.comment: calculate mass of convective condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

cnc.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
cnc.comment: Percentage of area covered by vegetation.

cw.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
cw.comment: 'Amount' means mass per unit area. 'Water' means water in all phases, including frozen i.e. ice and snow. 'Canopy' means the plant or vegetation canopy. The canopy water is the water on the canopy.

dcw.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
dcw.comment: The phrase 'change_over_time_in_X' means change in a quantity X over a time-interval, which should be defined by the bounds of the time coordinate. 'Canopy' means the plant or vegetation canopy. Canopy water is the water on the canopy. 'Water' means water in all phases, including frozen, i.e. ice and snow. 'Amount' means mass per unit area.

dgw.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
dgw.comment: Groundwater is subsurface water below the depth of the water table.

dmlt.comment: Depth from surface to the zero degree isotherm. Above this isotherm T > 0o, and below this line T < 0o. Missing if surface is frozen or if soil is unfrozen at all depths.

drivw.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
drivw.comment: Change over time of the mass of water per unit area in the fluvial system (stream and floodplain).

dslw.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
dslw.comment: The phrase 'change_over_time_in_X' means change in a quantity X over a time-interval, which should be defined by the bounds of the time coordinate. 'Content' indicates a quantity per unit area. The mass content of water in soil refers to the vertical integral from the surface down to the bottom of the soil model. For the content between specified levels in the soil, standard names including 'content_of_soil_layer' are used. 'Water' means water in all phases.

dsn.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
dsn.comment: Change in time of the mass per unit area of ice in glaciers, ice caps, ice sheets and shelves, river and lake ice, any other ice on a land surface, such as frozen flood water, and snow lying on such ice or on the land surface.

dsw.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
dsw.comment: The phrase 'land_water_amount', often known as 'Terrestrial Water Storage', includes: surface liquid water (water in rivers, wetlands, lakes, reservoirs, rainfall intercepted by the canopy); surface ice and snow (glaciers, ice caps, grounded ice sheets not displacing sea water, river and lake ice, other surface ice such as frozen flood water, snow lying on the surface and intercepted by the canopy); subsurface water (liquid and frozen soil water, groundwater).

dtes.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
dtes.comment: Change in heat storage over the soil layer and the vegetation for which the energy balance is calculated, accumulated over the sampling time interval.

dtesn.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
dtesn.long_name: Change in Snow and Ice Cold Content
dtesn.comment: Change in cold content over the snow layer for which the energy balance is calculated, accumulated over the sampling time interval. This should also include the energy contained in the liquid water in the snow pack.

ec.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
ec.comment: 'Water' means water in all phases. 'Canopy' means the plant or vegetation canopy. Evaporation is the conversion of liquid or solid into vapor. (The conversion of solid alone into vapor is called 'sublimation'.) In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics. Unless indicated in the cell_methods attribute, a quantity is assumed to apply to the whole area of each horizontal grid box. Previously, the qualifier where_type was used to specify that the quantity applies only to the part of the grid box of the named type.  Names containing the where_type qualifier are deprecated and newly created data should use the cell_methods attribute to indicate the horizontal area to which the quantity applies.

eow.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
eow.comment: Evaporation (conversion of liquid or solid into vapor) from open water.

es.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
es.comment: Water here means water in all phases. Evaporation is the conversion of liquid or solid into vapor. (The conversion of solid alone into vapor is called 'sublimation'.) In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.

esn.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
esn.comment: Water here means water in all phases. Evaporation is the conversion of liquid or solid into vapor. (The conversion of solid alone into vapor is called 'sublimation'.) In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics. Unless indicated in the cell_methods attribute, a quantity is assumed to apply to the whole area of each horizontal grid box. Previously, the qualifier where_type was used to specify that the quantity applies only to the part of the grid box of the named type.  Names containing the where_type qualifier are deprecated and newly created data should use the cell_methods attribute to indicate the horizontal area to which the quantity applies.

evspsbl.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
evspsbl.comment: Evaporation at surface (also known as evapotranspiration): flux of water into the atmosphere due to conversion of both liquid and solid phases to vapor (from underlying surface and vegetation)

evspsblpot.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
evspsblpot.comment: at surface; potential flux of water into the atmosphere due to conversion of both liquid and solid phases to vapor (from underlying surface and vegetation)

hfdsl.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
hfdsl.long_name: Downward Heat Flux at Land Surface
hfdsl.comment: The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'Downward' indicates a vector component which is positive when directed downward (negative upward). The vertical heat flux in air is the sum of all heat fluxes i.e. radiative, latent and sensible. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.

hfdsn.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
hfdsn.long_name: Downward Heat Flux into Snow Where Land over Land
hfdsn.comment: the net downward heat flux from the atmosphere into the snow that lies on land divided by the land area in the grid cell; reported as 0.0 for snow-free land regions or where the land fraction is 0.

hfdsnb.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
hfdsnb.long_name: Downward Heat Flux at Snow Base
hfdsnb.comment: Heat flux from snow into the ice or land under the snow.

hfls.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
hfls.comment: The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'Upward' indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). The surface latent heat flux is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air on account of evaporation (including sublimation). In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.

hfmlt.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
hfmlt.comment: Energy consumed or released during liquid/solid phase changes.

hfrs.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
hfrs.long_name: Heat Transferred to Snowpack by Rainfall
hfrs.comment: Heat transferred to a snow cover by rain..

hfsbl.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
hfsbl.comment: Energy consumed or released during vapor/solid phase changes.

hfss.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
hfss.comment: The surface sensible heat flux, also called turbulent heat flux, is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air by motion of air.

hursminCrop.cell_methods: area: mean where crops time: minimum
hursminCrop.long_name: Daily Minimum Near-Surface Relative Humidity over Crop Tile
hursminCrop.comment: The relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

hus.comment: Specific humidity is the mass fraction of water vapor in (moist) air.

hus850.comment: Specific humidity is the mass fraction of water vapor in (moist) air.

jpdftaureicemodis.long_name: MODIS Joint Distribution of Optical Thickness and Particle Size, Ice
jpdftaureicemodis.comment: Joint probability distribution function, giving probability of cloud as a function of optical thickness and particle size, as measured by MODIS. For cloud ice particles.

jpdftaureliqmodis.long_name: MODIS Optical Thickness-Particle Size Joint Distribution, Liquid
jpdftaureliqmodis.comment: Joint probability distribution function, giving probability of cloud as a function of optical thickness and particle size, as measured by MODIS. For liquid cloud particles.

lai.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
lai.comment: A ratio obtained by dividing the total upper leaf surface area of vegetation by the (horizontal) surface area of the land on which it grows.

loadbc.comment: The total dry mass of black carbon aerosol particles per unit area.

loaddust.comment: The total dry mass of dust aerosol particles per unit area.

loadnh4.comment: The total dry mass of ammonium aerosol particles per unit area.

loadno3.comment: The total dry mass of nitrate aerosol particles per unit area.

loadoa.long_name: Load of Dry Aerosol Organic Matter
loadoa.comment: atmosphere dry organic content: This is the vertically integrated sum of atmosphere_primary_organic_content and atmosphere_secondary_organic_content (see next two table entries).

loadpoa.long_name: Load of Dry Aerosol Primary Organic Matter
loadpoa.comment: The total dry mass of primary particulate organic aerosol particles per unit area.

loadso4.comment: The total dry mass of sulfate aerosol particles per unit area.

loadsoa.long_name: Load of Dry Aerosol Secondary Organic Matter
loadsoa.comment: The total dry mass of secondary particulate organic aerosol particles per unit area.

loadss.comment: The total dry mass of sea salt aerosol particles per unit area.

lwsnl.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
lwsnl.long_name: Liquid Water Content of Snow Layer
lwsnl.comment: The total mass of liquid water contained interstitially within the whole depth of the snow layer of the land portion of a grid cell divided by the area of the land portion of the cell.

mlotst.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
mlotst.long_name: Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Sigma T
mlotst.comment: Sigma T is potential density referenced to ocean surface.

mrfsofr.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
mrfsofr.long_name: Average Layer Fraction of Frozen Moisture
mrfsofr.comment: Fraction of soil moisture mass in the solid phase in each user-defined soil layer (3D variable)

mrlqso.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
mrlqso.long_name: Average Layer Fraction of Liquid Moisture
mrlqso.comment: Fraction of soil moisture mass in the liquid phase in each user-defined soil layer (3D variable)

mrrob.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
mrrob.comment: Runoff is the liquid water which drains from land. If not specified, 'runoff' refers to the sum of surface runoff and subsurface drainage. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.

mrros.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
mrros.comment: The total surface run off leaving the land portion of the grid cell (excluding drainage through the base of the soil model).

mrsfl.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
mrsfl.long_name: Frozen Water Content of Soil Layer
mrsfl.comment: in each soil layer, the mass of water in ice phase.  Reported as 'missing' for grid cells occupied entirely by 'sea'

mrsll.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
mrsll.long_name: Liquid Water Content of Soil Layer
mrsll.comment: in each soil layer, the mass of water in liquid phase.  Reported as 'missing' for grid cells occupied entirely by 'sea'

mrsol.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
mrsol.long_name: Total Water Content of Soil Layer
mrsol.comment: in each soil layer, the mass of water in all phases, including ice.  Reported as 'missing' for grid cells occupied entirely by 'sea'

mrsow.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
mrsow.comment: Vertically integrated soil moisture divided by maximum allowable soil moisture above wilting point.

mrtws.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
mrtws.comment: Mass of water in all phases and in all components including soil, canopy, vegetation, ice sheets, rivers and ground water.

nudgincsm.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
nudgincsm.long_name: Nudging Increment of Water in Soil Moisture
nudgincsm.comment: A nudging increment refers to an amount added to parts of a model system. The phrase 'nudging_increment_in_X' refers to an increment in quantity X over a time period which should be defined in the bounds of the time coordinate. 'Content' indicates a quantity per unit area. 'Water' means water in all phases. The mass content of water in soil refers to the vertical integral from the surface down to the bottom of the soil model. The 'soil content' of a quantity refers to the vertical integral from the surface down to the bottom of the soil model. For the content between specified levels in the soil, standard names including 'content_of_soil_layer' are used.

nudgincswe.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
nudgincswe.long_name: Nudging Increment of Water in Snow
nudgincswe.comment: A nudging increment refers to an amount added to parts of a model system. The phrase 'nudging_increment_in_X' refers to an increment in quantity X over a time period which should be defined in the bounds of the time coordinate. The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'Amount' means mass per unit area. 'Snow and ice on land' means ice in glaciers, ice caps, ice sheets & shelves, river and lake ice, any other ice on a land surface, such as frozen flood water, and snow lying on such ice or on the land surface.

parasolRefl.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
parasolRefl.comment: Simulated reflectance from PARASOL as seen at the top of the atmosphere for 5 solar zenith angles. Valid only over ocean and for one viewing direction (viewing zenith angle of 30 degrees and relative azimuth angle 320 degrees).

pflw.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
pflw.long_name: Liquid Water Content of Permafrost Layer
pflw.comment: *where land over land*, i.e., this is the total mass of liquid water contained within the permafrost layer within the land portion of a grid cell divided by the area of the land portion of the cell.

prCrop.cell_methods: area: time: mean where crops (comment: mask=cropFrac)
prCrop.comment: includes both liquid and solid phases

prhmax.cell_methods: area: mean time: mean within hours time: maximum over hours
prhmax.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.

prra.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
prra.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.

prrc.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
prrc.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.

prrsn.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
prrsn.comment: The fraction of the grid averaged rainfall which falls on the snow pack

prsnc.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
prsnc.comment: convective precipitation of all forms of water in the solid phase.

prsnsn.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
prsnsn.long_name: Fraction of Snowfall (Including Hail and Graupel) on Snow
prsnsn.comment: The fraction of the snowfall which falls on the snow pack

prveg.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
prveg.comment: The precipitation flux that is intercepted by the vegetation canopy (if present in model) before reaching the ground.

prw.comment: vertically integrated through the atmospheric column

qgwr.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
qgwr.comment: Mass flux of water from the soil layer into ground water.

reffcclwtop.long_name: Cloud-Top Effective Droplet Radius in Convective Cloud
reffcclwtop.comment: Droplets are liquid only.  This is the effective radius 'as seen from space' over convective liquid cloudy portion of grid cell.  This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, or for some models it is the sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Reported values are weighted by total liquid cloud top fraction of  (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.daily data, separated to large-scale clouds, convective clouds. If any of the cloud is from more than one process (i.e. shallow convection), please provide them separately.

reffsclwtop.long_name: Cloud-Top Effective Droplet Radius in Stratiform Cloud
reffsclwtop.comment: Droplets are liquid only.  This is the effective radius 'as seen from space' over liquid stratiform cloudy portion of grid cell.  This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, or for some models it is the sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Reported values are weighted by total liquid cloud top fraction of  (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.daily data, separated to large-scale clouds, convective clouds. If any of the cloud is from more than one process (i.e. shallow convection), please provide them separately.

rivi.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
rivi.comment: Inflow of River Water into Cell

rivo.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
rivo.comment: Outflow of River Water from Cell

rls.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

rsdscsdiff.long_name: Surface Diffuse Downwelling Clear Sky Shortwave Radiation
rsdscsdiff.comment: Surface downwelling solar irradiance from diffuse radiation for UV calculations in clear sky conditions

rsdsdiff.comment: Surface downwelling solar irradiance from diffuse radiation for UV calculations.

rss.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
rss.comment: Net downward shortwave radiation at the surface

rzwc.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
rzwc.comment: 'Content' indicates a quantity per unit area. The content of a soil layer is the vertical integral of the specified quantity within the layer. The quantity with standard name mass_content_of_water_in_soil_layer_defined_by_root_depth is the vertical integral between the surface and the depth to which plant roots penetrate. A coordinate variable or scalar coordinate variable with standard name root_depth can be used to specify the extent of the layer. 'Water' means water in all phases.

sbl.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
sbl.long_name: Surface Snow and Ice Sublimation Flux
sbl.comment: The snow and ice sublimation flux is the loss of snow and ice mass per unit area from the surface resulting from their direct conversion to water vapor that enters the atmosphere.

sblnosn.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
sblnosn.long_name: Sublimation of the Snow Free Area
sblnosn.comment: Rate of sublimation of ice into the atmosphere from areas with no snow.

scldncl.long_name: Cloud Droplet Number Concentration of Stratiform Cloud Tops
scldncl.comment: Droplets are liquid only.  Report concentration 'as seen from space' over stratiform liquid cloudy portion of grid cell.  This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, it is better to sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Weight by total liquid cloud top fraction of  (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.

snd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
snd.comment: where land over land, this is computed as the mean thickness of snow in the land portion of the grid cell (averaging over the entire land portion, including the snow-free fraction).  Reported as 0.0 where the land fraction is 0.

snm.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
snm.comment: The total surface snow melt rate on the land portion of the grid cell divided by the land area in the grid cell; report as zero for snow-free land regions and missing where there is no land.

snmsl.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
snmsl.comment: Mass flow rate of water draining out of the snow pack.

snrefr.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
snrefr.long_name: Refreezing of Water in the Snow
snrefr.comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics. The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'Surface snow and ice refreezing flux' means the mass flux of surface  meltwater which refreezes within the snow or firn.

snwc.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
snwc.long_name: snow water equivalent intercepted by the vegetation
snwc.comment: Total water mass of the snowpack (liquid or frozen), averaged over a grid cell and intercepted by the canopy.

sootsn.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
sootsn.comment: the entire land portion of the grid cell is considered, with snow soot content set to 0.0 in regions free of snow.

sw.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
sw.comment: Total liquid water storage, other than soil, snow or interception storage (i.e. lakes, river channel or depression storage).

t20d.cell_methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
t20d.comment: This quantity, sometimes called the 'isotherm depth', is the depth (if it exists) at which the sea water potential temperature equals some specified value. This value should be specified in a scalar coordinate variable. Depth is the vertical distance below the surface. Potential temperature is the temperature a parcel of air or sea water would have if moved adiabatically to sea level pressure.

tasmaxCrop.cell_methods: area: mean where crops time: maximum
tasmaxCrop.long_name: Daily Maximum Near-Surface Air Temperature over Crop Tile
tasmaxCrop.comment: maximum near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature (add cell_method attribute 'time: max')

tasminCrop.cell_methods: area: mean where crops time: minimum
tasminCrop.long_name: Daily Minimum Near-Surface Air Temperature over Crop Tile
tasminCrop.comment: minimum near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature (add cell_method attribute 'time: min')

tau.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
tau.comment: module of the momentum lost by the atmosphere to the surface.

tauu.comment: Downward eastward wind stress at the surface

tauupbl.long_name: Eastward Surface Stress from Planetary Boundary Layer Scheme
tauupbl.comment: The  downward eastward stress associated with the models parameterization of the planetary boundary layer. (This request is related to a WGNE effort to understand how models parameterize the surface stresses.)

tauv.comment: Downward northward wind stress at the surface

tauvpbl.long_name: Northward Surface Stress from Planetary Boundary Layer Scheme
tauvpbl.comment: The  downward northward stress associated with the models parameterization of the planetary boundary layer. (This request is related to a WGNE effort to understand how models parameterize the surface stresses.)

tcs.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
tcs.comment: Vegetation temperature, averaged over all vegetation types

tdps.comment: Dew point temperature is the temperature at which a parcel of air reaches saturation upon being cooled at constant pressure and specific humidity.

tgs.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean

tpf.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
tpf.comment: The mean thickness of the permafrost layer in the land portion of the grid cell.  Reported as zero in permafrost-free regions.

tr.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
tr.comment: Effective radiative surface temperature, averaged over the grid cell

tran.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
tran.comment: Transpiration (may include dew formation as a negative flux).

ts.comment: Temperature of the lower boundary of the atmosphere

tsl.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
tsl.comment: Temperature of soil. Reported as missing for grid cells with no land.

tsland.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
tsland.comment: Temperature of the lower boundary of the atmosphere

tsn.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean (with samples weighted by snow mass)
tsn.comment: This temperature is averaged over all the snow in the grid cell that rests on land or land ice.  When computing the time-mean here, the time samples, weighted by the mass of snow on the land portion of the grid cell, are accumulated and then divided by the sum of the weights.   Reported as missing in regions free of snow on land.

tsns.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
tsns.comment: Temperature of the snow surface as it interacts with the atmosphere, averaged over a grid cell.

ua.comment: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction).

va.comment: Meridional wind (positive in a northward direction).

wap.comment: Omega (vertical velocity in pressure coordinates, positive downwards)

wtd.cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
wtd.comment: Depth is the vertical distance below the surface. The water table is the surface below which the soil is saturated with water such that all pore spaces are filled.

zg.comment: Geopotential is the sum of the specific gravitational potential energy relative to the geoid and the specific centripetal potential energy. Geopotential height is the geopotential divided by the standard acceleration due to gravity. It is numerically similar to the altitude (or geometric height) and not to the quantity with standard name height, which is relative to the surface.

zmla.comment: The atmosphere boundary layer thickness is the 'depth' or 'height' of the (atmosphere) planetary boundary layer.
